Ninth President of the Federal Republic of Germany (2004 â 2010)
On 23 May 2004, Horst KÃ¶hler was elected ninth President of the Federal Republic of Germany.
He took office in July 2004 and was reelected for a second term in May 2009.
He took office in July 2004 and was reelected for a second term in May 2009.
He resigned from office on 31 May 2010.
Post-Presidency and 'Elder Statesman' (2010 â 2025)
In 2012, then Secretary-General of the United Nations, Ban Ki-Moon, appointed Horst KÃ¶hler as a member of the High Level Panel of Eminent Persons on the Post-2015 Development Agenda.
The panel report laid the foundation for the Agenda 2030 for Sustainable Development which was adopted by the United Nations in 2015.
From 2016 to 2017 he co-chaired, together with Kofi Annan, a Special Panel advising the African Development Bank on the implementation of its strategies.
In August 2017 Horst Koehler was appointed by United Nations Secretary-General, AntÃ³nio Guterres, to be his Personal Envoy for Western Sahara, a position he held until May 2019.
In August 2017 Horst Koehler was appointed by United Nations Secretary-General, AntÃ³nio Guterres, to be his Personal Envoy for Western Sahara, a position he held until May 2019.
In 2006, Horst KÃ¶hler and his wife initiated the establishment of the Eva Luise and Horst KÃ¶hler Foundation, which seeks to improve medical care for people with rare diseases.
